QuestionStatement: Which of the following is true of an economy with the production possibilities frontier shown above?
AnswerChoices: Point Q is attainable but undesirable
Point R is unattainable but desirable
A technological improvement in the production of watches would move the economy from point T to point P
The opportunity cost of moving from point S to point T is the number of watches given up

QuestionStatement: Increases in real income per capita are made possible by
The sum of which of the following expenditures is equal to the value of the gross domestic product?
AnswerChoices: Consumer purchases, investment for capital goods, exports, and imports
Consumer purchases, investment for capital goods, net exports, and inventories
Consumer purchases, investment for capital goods, government purchases, and net exports
Consumer purchases, government purchases, exports, and national income
Investment for capital goods, government purchases, net exports, and inventories

QuestionStatement: Which of the following would most likely lead to a decrease in aggregate demand, that is, shift the aggregate demand curve leftward?
AnswerChoices: An increase in business firms’ purchases of capital equipment from retained earnings

QuestionStatement: According to the Keynesian model, equilibrium output of an economy may be less than the full-employment level of output because at full employment
AnswerChoices: Sufficient income may or may not be generated to keep workers above the subsistence levels
There might not be enough demand by firms and consumers to buy that output
Workers may not be willing to work the hours necessary to produce the output
Interest rates might not be high enough to provide the incentive to finance the production
Banks may not be willing to lend enough money to support output

QuestionStatement: The principal reason for requiring commercial banks to maintain reserve balances with the Federal Reserve is that these balances
AnswerChoices: Provide the maximum amount of reserves a bank would ever need
Give the Federal Reserve more control over the money-creating operations of banks
Ensure that banks do not make excessive profits
Assist the Treasury in refinancing government debt
Enable the government to borrow cheaply from the Federal Reserve’s discount window

QuestionStatement: If the Federal Reserve lowers the reserve requirement, which of the following is most likely to happen to interest rates and gross national product?

If the nominal interest rate is 6 percent the expected inflation rate is 4 percent, the real interest rate is
Supply side economists argue that
AnswerChoices: A cut in high tax rates results in an increased deficit and thus increases aggregate supply
Lower tax rates provide positive work incentives and thus shift the aggregate supply curve to the right
The aggregate supply of goods can only be increased if the price level falls
Increased government spending should be used to stimulate the economy
The government should regulate the supply of imports

QuestionStatement: If the dollar cost of the British pound decreases, United States imports from and exports to the United Kingdom will change in which of the following ways?

An economy that is fully employing all its productive resources but allocating less to investment than to consumption will be at which of the following positions on the production possibilities curve shown above?
The United States government defines an individual as unemployed if the person
AnswerChoices: Does not hold a paying job
Works part time but needs full time work
Is without a job but is looking for work
Wants a job but is not searching because he or she thinks that none is available

QuestionStatement: The gross domestic product is best described as a measure of
AnswerChoices: The full employment output of an economy
All monetary transactions in an economy
Current final output produced by an economy

QuestionStatement: An increase in which of the following would cause the long-run aggregate supply curve to shift to the right?
Total spending in the economy is most likely to increase by the largest amount if which of the following occur to government spending and taxes?
If businesses are experiencing an unplanned increase in inventories, which of the following is most likely to be true?
AnswerChoices: Aggregate demand is greater than output, and the level of spending will increase
Aggregate demand is less than output, and the level of spending will decrease
The economy is growing and will continue to grow until a new equilibrium level of spending is reached
Planned investment is greater than planned saving, and the level of spending will decrease
Planned investment is less than planned saving, and the level of spending will increase

AnswerChoices: Decrease the number of Federal Reserve notes in circulation
